lines.value: on 27 february 2009 a free trade agreement with the asean regional block of 10 countries and australia and its close partner new zealand was signed it is estimated that this fta would boost aggregate gdp across the 12 countries by more than us$48 billion over the period 2000 2020
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: asean members together with the group's six major trading partners - australia china india japan new zealand and south korea - have began the first round of negotiations on 26 28 february 2013 in bali indonesia on establishment of the regional comprehensive economic partnership
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: since the post independence phases of southeast asian states efforts were made to implement regional foreign policies but with a unifying focus to refrain from interference in domestic affairs of member states
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: there was a move to unify the region under what was called the asean way based on the ideals of non interference informality minimal institutionalisation consultation and consensus non use of force and non confrontation
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: asean members especially singapore approved of the term asean way to describe a regional method of multilateralism
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: thus the signing of the treaty of amity and cooperation in southeast asia adopted fundamental principles
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: the asean way can be seen as divergent from the contextual contemporary political reality at the formative stages of the association
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: a critical distinction is made by amitav acharya that the asean way indicates a process of regional interactions and cooperation based on discreteness informality consensus building and non confrontational bargaining styles that contrasts with the adversarial posturing majority vote and other legalistic decision making procedures in western multilateral organisations
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: however critics argue that the asean way serves as the major stumbling block to it becoming a true diplomacy mechanism
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: due to the consensus based approach every member has a veto so contentious issues must remain unresolved until agreements can be reached
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: moreover it is claimed that member nations are directly and indirectly advocating that asean be more flexible and allow discourse on internal affairs of member countries.additionally the preference for informal discussions to adversarial negotiations limits the leverage of diplomatic solutions within asean
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: michael yahuda explains in his book international politics of the asia pacific 2003 second and revised edition the limitations of the asean way
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: in summary of his argument unlike the european union the asean way has made asean members never aspired to an economic and political union
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: it was designed to sustain the independence and sovereignty of member states and to encourage regional and national stability
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: asean differed in assessment of external threat and they operated within conditions in which legality and the rule of law were not generally consolidated within member states
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: asean wasn't a rule making body subjecting its members to the discipline of adhering its laws and regulations
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: it was operated through consensus and informality
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: also the member states avoided to confront certain issues if they were to result in conflicts
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: the organisation holds meetings known as the asean summit where heads of government of each member meet to discuss and resolve regional issues as well as to conduct other meetings with other countries outside of the bloc with the intention of promoting external relations
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: the asean leaders formal summit was first held in bali indonesia in 1976
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: its third meeting was held in manila in 1987 and during this meeting it was decided that the leaders would meet every five years
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: consequently the fourth meeting was held in singapore in 1992 where the leaders again agreed to meet more frequently deciding to hold the summit every three years
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: in 2001 it was decided to meet annually to address urgent issues affecting the region
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: member nations were assigned to be the summit host in alphabetical order except in the case of burma which dropped its 2006 hosting rights in 2004 due to pressure from the united states and the european union

lines.value: the usual itinerary is as follows

lines.value: the east asia summit eas is a pan asian forum held annually by the leaders of 16 countries in east asia and the region with asean in a leadership position

lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: the members of the summit are all 10 members of asean plus china japan south korea india australia and new zealand

lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: the host country invites the heads of government of asean member countries to discuss future cooperation and partnership
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: as of july 2007 it consists of 27 participants

lines.value: the current participants in the arf are as follows all the asean members australia bangladesh canada the people's republic of china the european union india japan north korea south korea mongolia new zealand pakistan papua new guinea russia east timor united states and sri lanka

lines.value: since 1 december 2008 restrictions on the third and fourth freedoms of the air between capital cities of member states for air passengers services have been removed while from 1 january 2009 full liberalisation of air freight services in the region took effect

lines.value: on 15 december 2008 the members of asean met in the indonesian capital of jakarta to launch a charter signed in november 2007 with the aim of moving closer to an eu style community

lines.value: the charter turns asean into a legal entity and aims to create a single free trade area for the region encompassing 500 million people

lines.value: president of indonesia susilo bambang yudhoyono stated that this is a momentous development when asean is consolidating integrating and transforming itself into a community

lines.value: it is achieved while asean seeks a more vigorous role in asian and global affairs at a time when the international system is experiencing a seismic shift he added referring to climate change and economic upheaval and concluded southeast asia is no longer the bitterly divided war torn region it was in the 1960s and 1970s

lines.value: the fundamental principles include a respect for the independence sovereignty equality territorial integrity and national identity of all asean member states b shared commitment and collective responsibility in enhancing regional peace security and prosperity c renunciation of aggression and of the threat or use of force or other actions in any manner inconsistent with international law d reliance on peaceful settlement of disputes e non interference in the internal affairs of asean member states f respect for the right of every member state to lead its national existence free from external interference subversion and coercion g enhanced consultations on matters seriously affecting the common interest of asean h adherence to the rule of law good governance the principles of democracy and constitutional government i respect for fundamental freedoms the promotion and protection of human rights and the promotion of social justice j upholding the united nations charter and international law including international humanitarian law subscribed to by asean member states k abstention from participation in any policy or activity including the use of its territory pursued by an asean member state or non asean state or any non state actor which threatens the sovereignty territorial integrity or political and economic stability of asean member states l respect for the different cultures languages and religions of the peoples of asean while emphasising their common values in the spirit of unity in diversity m the centrality of asean in external political economic social and cultural relations while remaining actively engaged outward looking inclusive and non discriminatory and n adherence to multilateral trade rules and asean's rules based regimes for effective implementation of economic commitments and progressive reduction towards elimination of all barriers to regional economic integration in a market driven economy
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: however the ongoing global financial crisis was stated as being a threat to the goals envisioned by the charter and also set forth the idea of a proposed human rights body to be discussed at a future summit in february 2009

lines.value: as the collective entity to enhance regional cooperation in education the asean education ministers have determined four priorities that asean efforts toward improved education would address 1 promoting asean awareness among asean citizens particularly youth 2 strengthening asean identity through education 3 building asean human resources in the field of education and 4 strengthening asean university networking
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: nations such as malaysia singapore indonesia thailand and the philippines have experienced rapid development over the past 20 years and this has been visibly evident in their educational systems
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: each country has developed unique yet interconnected through asean initiatives human and physical infrastructure to provide youth education a primary determinant in future capabilities and sustained economic growth for the entire region

lines.value: various programmes and projects have been and are currently in the process of being developed to fulfil these directives and to reach these future goals

lines.value: the aun was established to assist asean in 1 promoting cooperation among asean scholars academics and scientists in the region 2 developing academic and professional human resources in the region 3 promoting information dissemination among the asean academic community and 4 enhancing the awareness of regional identity and the sense of asean ness among members

lines.value: education indicators outlined hereafter belong to primary secondary and tertiary levels
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: primary education is generally defined as the level of education where children are provided with basic reading writing and mathematical skills together with elementary understanding of such subjects as history geography natural science social science art and music
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: secondary education continues to build up on the knowledge provided by primary education and aims at laying the foundations for lifelong learning and human development with more advanced material and learning mechanisms
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: tertiary education whether or not leading to an advanced research qualification requires minimally the successful completion of secondary education for admission and entails the level of education within some college or university
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: participation in formal education is usually measured by the metric gross enrollment ratio ger and net enrollment ratio ner
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: the ner demonstrates the extent of participation in a given age specific level of education
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: the purpose of the ger is to show the total enrollment in a level of education regardless of age
lines.name: Khmer

​រូប​សំណាក ព្រះបាទស៊ីសុវត្ថិ ដែល​តម្កល់​នៅ​ត្រង់​ចង្កេះ​ភ្នំ​ដូនពេញ ផ្នែក​ខាងត្បូង​ក៏​ជា​កេរ​តំណែល ប្រវត្តិសាស្ដ្រ​មួយ​ដ៏​សំខាន់​ផង​ដែរ ក្នុង​សម័យ​កម្ពុជា​ស្ថិត​នៅ​ក្រោម រាជ​ការ​អាណា​ព្យាបាល​បារាំង។ ព្រោះ​ថា​រូប​សំណាក​នេះ ជា​និមិត្តរូបនៃ​​ការ​ថ្វាយ​បូរណភាព​ទឹក​ដី​នៃ ខេត្តសៀមរាប បាត់ដំបង និង​សិរីសោភ័ណ្ឌ​ឲ្យ​មក​ស្ថិត​នៅ​ក្រោមការគ្រប់គ្រង​របស់​ព្រះមហាក្សត្រខ្មែរ​វិញ ។ ព្រះបាទស៊ីសុវត្ថិ ត្រូវ​បាន​ក្រុម​ជំនុំ​ធំ​សម្រាប់​ព្រះបរមរាជវាំង រៀបចំ​ពិធី​អភិសេក ឲ្យ​ឡើង​គ្រងរាជ្យ​សម្បត្តិ ក្នុង​គ្រឹស្តសករាជ១៩០៦ បន្ទាប់​ពី​ព្រះបាទនរោត្តម ទ្រង់​ចូល​សុវណ្ណគត។ កាលនោះ​ព្រះបាទស៊ីសុវត្ថិ​មាន​ព្រះជន ៦៤ព្រះវស្សា ។ មុន​ឡើង​គ្រងរាជសម្បត្តិ ព្រះបាទស៊ីសុវត្ថិ គឺ​ជា​ស្ដេច​ព្រះឧបរាជ​ដ៏​ក្លាហាន​មួយ​ព្រះអង្គ ដែល​មិន​ចេះ​ខ្លាច​ញញើត​ឡើយ​ចំពោះ​ការ​នាំ​ទ័ព​ទៅ​ធ្វើ​សង្គ្រាម បង្ក្រាប​ពួក​បះបោរ គ.ស១៨៦១-១៨៨៤)។ បណ្តា​ប្រជារាស្ដ្រ​គោរព​ស្រឡាញ់ ព្រះអង្គ​ជា​ក្សត្រ​ដែល​មាន​ព្រះទ័យ​ទូលំទូលាយ ចេះ​រាក់​ទាក់ និង​យោគយល់​អធ្យាស្រ័យ​ល្អ ចំពោះ​អ្នក​ផង​ទាំងពួង។ lines.value: to the north of cuba lies the united states 140 km or 90 mi away and the bahamas mexico is to the west the cayman islands and jamaica are to the south and haiti and the dominican republic are to the southeast
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: in 1492 christopher columbus landed on and claimed the island now occupied by cuba for the kingdom of spain
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: cuba remained a territory of spain until the spanish american war ended in 1898 and gained formal independence from the us in 1902
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: a fragile democracy increasingly dominated by radical politics eventually evolved solidified by the cuban constitution of 1940 but was definitely quashed in 1952 by former president fulgencio batista and an authoritarian regime was set up intensifying and catalyzing already rampant corruption political repression and crippling economic regulations
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: batista was ousted in january 1959 by the july 26 movement and a new administration under fidel castro established which had by 1965 evolved into a single party state under the revived communist party of cuba which holds power to date
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: cuba is home to over 11 million people and is the most populous island nation in the caribbean as well as the largest by area
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: its people culture and customs draw from diverse sources such as the aboriginal taino and ciboney peoples the period of spanish colonialism the introduction of african slaves and its proximity to the united states
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: cuba has a 99.8% literacy rate an infant death rate lower than some developed countries and an average life expectancy of 77.64
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: in 2006 cuba was the only nation in the world which met the wwf's definition of sustainable development having an ecological footprint of less than 1.8 hectares per capita and a human development index of over 0.8 for 2007
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: the name cuba comes from the taino language
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: the exact meaning of the name is unclear but it may be translated either as where fertile land is abundant cubao or great place coabana
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: authors who believe that christopher columbus was portuguese state that cuba was named by columbus for the ancient town of cuba in the district of beja in portugal
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: cuba was inhabited by native american people known as the taino also called arawak by the spanish and guanajatabey and ciboney people before the arrival of the spanish
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: the ancestors of these native americans migrated from the mainland of north central and south america several centuries earlier
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: the native tainos called the island caobana
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: the taino were farmers and the ciboney were farmers fishers and hunter gatherers
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: after first landing on an island then called guanahani on 1492 christopher columbus landed on cuba's northeastern coast near what is now baracoa on or 28
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: he claimed the island for the new kingdom of spain and named isla juana after juan prince of asturias
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: in 1511 the first spanish settlement was founded by diego velazquez de cuellar at baracoa other towns soon followed including the future capital of san cristobal de la habana which was founded in 1515
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: the native tainos were working under the encomienda system which resembled a feudal system in medieval europe
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: within a century the indigenous people were virtually wiped out due to multiple factors including eurasian infectious diseases aggravated in large part by a lack of natural resistance as well as privation stemming from repressive colonial subjugation
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: in 1529 a measles outbreak in cuba killed two thirds of the natives who had previously survived smallpox
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: cuba remained a spanish possession for almost 400 years 1511-1898 with an economy based on plantation agriculture mining and the export of sugar coffee and tobacco to europe and later to north america
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: the work was done primarily by african slaves brought to the island
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: the small land owning elite of spanish settlers held social and economic powers supported by a population of spaniards born on the island criollos other europeans and african descended slaves
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: the population in 1817 was 630980 of which 291021 were white 115691 free black and 224268 black slaves
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: in the 1820s when the rest of spain's empire in latin america rebelled and formed independent states cuba remained loyal
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: although there was agitation for independence the spanish crown gave cuba the motto la siempre fidelisima isla the always most faithful island
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: this loyalty was due partly to cuban settlers dependence on spain for trade their desire for protection from pirates and against a slave rebellion and partly because they feared the rising power of the united states more than they disliked spanish rule
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: independence from spain was the motive for a rebellion in 1868 led by carlos manuel de cespedes
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: de cespedes a sugar planter freed his slaves to fight with him for a free cuba
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: on 27 december 1868 he issued a decree condemning slavery in theory but accepting it in practice and declaring free any slaves whose masters present them for military service
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: the 1868 rebellion resulted in a prolonged conflict known as the ten years war
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: the united states declined to recognize the new cuban government although many european and latin american nations did so
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: in 1878 the pact of zanjon ended the conflict with spain promising greater autonomy to cuba
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: in 1879 1880 cuban patriot calixto garcia attempted to start another war known as the little war but received little support
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: in cuba a sophisticated and prosperous sugar industry had employed chattel slavery until the final third of the 19th century
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: cuba produced 720250 metric tons of sugar in 1868 more than forty percent of cane sugar reaching the world market that year
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: slavery had been maintained in cuba however while abolition was underway elsewhere
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: abolition in cuba began the final third of the 19th century and was completed in the 1880s
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: an exiled dissident named jose marti founded the cuban revolutionary party in new york in 1892
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: the aim of the party was to achieve cuban independence from spain
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: in marti traveled to montecristi and santo domingo to join the efforts of maximo gomez
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: marti recorded his political views in the manifesto of montecristi
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: fighting against the spanish army began in cuba on 1895 but marti was unable to reach cuba until 1895
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: marti was killed in the battle of dos rios on 1895
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: his death immortalized him as cuba's national hero
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: around 200000 spanish troops outnumbered the much smaller rebel army which relied mostly on guerrilla and sabotage tactics
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: the spaniards began a campaign of suppression
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: general valeriano weyler military governor of cuba herded the rural population into what he called reconcentrados described by international observers as fortified towns
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: these are often considered the prototype for 20th-century concentration camps
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: between 200000 and 400000 cuban civilians died from starvation and disease in the camps numbers verified by the red cross and united states senator and former secretary of war redfield proctor
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: american and european protests against spanish conduct on the island followed
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: the us battleship maine arrived in havana on 1898 to offer protection to the 8000 american residents on the island but the spanish saw this as intimidation
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: on the evening of 1898 the maine blew up in the harbor killing 252 crew
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: another eight crew members died of their wounds in hospital over the next few days
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: a naval board of inquiry headed by captain william t sampson was appointed to investigate the cause of the explosion on the maine
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: having examined the wreck and taken testimony from eyewitnesses and experts the board reported on 1898 that the maine had been destroyed by a double magazine set off from the exterior of the ship which could only have been produced by a mine the facts remain disputed today although an investigation by admiral hyman g rickover published in 1976 established that the blast was most likely a large internal explosion
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: rickover believes the explosion was caused by a spontaneous combustion in inadequately ventilated bituminous coal which ignited gunpowder in an adjacent magazine
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: the original 1898 board was unable to fix the responsibility for the disaster but a furious american populace fueled by an active press- notably the newspapers of william randolph hearst- concluded that the spanish were to blame and demanded action
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: the us congress passed a resolution calling for intervention and president william mckinley complied
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: spain and the united states declared war on each other in late april
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: after the spanish american war spain and the united states signed the treaty of paris 1898 by which spain ceded puerto rico the philippines and guam to the united states for the sum of
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: under the same treaty spain relinquished all claim of sovereignty over cuba
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: theodore roosevelt who had fought in the spanish american war and had some sympathies with the independence movement succeeded mckinley as us president in 1901 and abandoned the treaty
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: cuba gained formal independence from the us on 1902 as the republic of cuba
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: under cuba's new constitution the us retained the right to intervene in cuban affairs and to supervise its finances and foreign relations
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: under the platt amendment the us leased the guantanamo bay naval base from cuba
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: following disputed elections in 1906 the first president tomas estrada palma faced an armed revolt by independence war veterans who defeated the meager government forces
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: the us intervened by occupying cuba and named charles edward magoon as governor for three years
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: cuban historians have attributed magoon's governorship as having introduced political and social corruption
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: in 1908 self government was restored when jose miguel gomez was elected president but the us continued intervening in cuban affairs
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: in 1912 the partido independiente de color attempted to establish a separate black republic in oriente province but was suppressed by general monteagudo with considerable bloodshed
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: during world war i cuba exported considerable quantities of sugar to britain
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: cuba was able to avoid u boat attacks by the subterfuge of shipping the sugar to sweden
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: the menocal government declared war on germany very soon after the united states
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: a constitutional government was maintained until 1930 when gerardo machado y morales suspended the constitution
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: during machado's tenure a nationalistic economic program was pursued with several major national development projects which included the carretera central and el capitolio
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: machado's hold on power was weakened following a decline in demand for exported agricultural produce due to the great depression attacks by independence war veterans and attacks by covert terrorist organizations principally the abc
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: during a general strike in which the communist party sided with machado the senior elements of the cuban army forced machado into exile
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: the party then installed carlos manuel de cespedes y quesada son of cuba's founding father carlos manuel de cespedes as president
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: during 4- 1933 a second coup overthrew cespedes which led to the formation of the first ramon grau government
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: notable events in this violent period include the separate sieges of hotel nacional de cuba and atares castle
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: this government lasted 100 days but engineered radical socialist changes in cuban society including the abolishment of the platt amendment and instating of womens suffrage in cuba
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: in 1934 grau was ousted in favor of carlos mendieta the first in a series of puppet presidents subordinate to the army and its young chief of staff fulgencio batista
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: fulgencio batista was democratically elected president in the elections of 1940 so far the only non white cuban endorsed for the nation's highest office
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: his government carried out major social reforms
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: several members of the communist party held office under his administration and established numerous economic regulations and pro union policies as well as the cuban constitution of 1940 which engineered radical progressive ideas including the right to labour and health care
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: batista's administration formally took cuba to the allies of world war ii camp in world war ii
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: cuba declared war on japan on 1941 then on germany and italy on , 1941
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: cuban armed forces were not greatly involved in combat during world war ii although president batista suggested a joint u.s.-latin american assault on francoist spain in order to overthrow its authoritarian regime
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: ramon grau who lost in 1940 to batista finally returned in the 1944 elections by defeating batista's preferred successor carlos saladrigas zayas
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: in 1948 his revolutionary authentic party won again when carlos prio socarras won the last person elected to the presidency by free and fair elections
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: the two terms of the autentico party saw an influx of investment fueled a boom which raised living standards for all segments of society and created a prosperous middle class in most urban areas
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: the 1952 election was a three way race
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: roberto agramonte of the ortodoxos party led in all the polls followed by dr aurelio hevia of the autentico party and fulgencio batista seeking a return to office as a distant third
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: both agramonte and hevia had decided to name col ramon barquin to head the cuban armed forces after the elections
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: barquin then a diplomat in washington dc was a top officer
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: he was respected by the professional army and had promised to eliminate corruption in the ranks
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: batista feared that barquin would oust him and his followers
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: when it became apparent that batista had little chance of winning he staged a coup on 1952
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: batista held on to power with the backing of a nationalist section of the army as a provisional president for the next two years
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: in march 1952 justo carrillo informed barquin in washington that the inner circles knew that batista had plotted the coup
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: they immediately began to conspire to oust batista and restore democracy and civilian government in what was later dubbed la conspiracion de los puros de 1956 agrupacion montecristi
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: in 1954 batista agreed to elections
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: the partido autentico put forward ex president grau as their candidate but he withdrew amid allegations that batista was rigging the elections in advance
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: in april 1956 batista ordered barquin to become general and chief of the army but barquin decided to move forward with his coup to secure total power
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: on 1956 a coup by hundreds of career officers led by barquin was frustrated by rios morejon
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: the coup broke the back of the cuban armed forces
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: the officers were sentenced to the maximum terms allowed by cuban martial law
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: barquin was sentenced to solitary confinement for eight years
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: la conspiracion de los puros resulted in the imprisonment of the commanders of the armed forces and the closing of the military academies
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: cuba had latin america's highest per capita consumption rates of meat vegetables cereals automobiles telephones and radios though about one third of the population was considered poor and enjoyed relatively little of this consumption
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: in 1958 cuba was a relatively well advanced country by latin american standards and in some cases by world standards
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: cuba attracted more immigrants primarily from europe as a percentage of population than the us the united nations noted cuba for its large middle class
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: on the other hand cuba was affected by perhaps the largest labor union privileges in latin america including bans on dismissals and mechanization
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: they were obtained in large measure at the cost of the unemployed and the peasants leading to disparities
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: between 1933 and 1958 cuba extended economic regulations enormously causing economic problems
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: unemployment became a problem as graduates entering the workforce could not find jobs
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: the middle class which was comparable to the united states became increasingly dissatisfied with unemployment and political persecution
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: the labor unions supported batista until the very end
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: on 2 december 1956 a party of 82 people on the yacht granma landed in cuba
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: the party led by fidel castro had the intention of establishing an armed resistance movement in the sierra maestra
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: while facing armed resistance from castro's rebel fighters in the mountains fulgencio batista's regime was weakened and crippled by a united states arms embargo imposed on 1958
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: by late 1958 the rebels broke out of the sierra maestra and launched a general popular insurrection
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: after the fighters captured santa clara batista fled from havana on 1959 to exile in portugal
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: barquin negotiated the symbolic change of command between camilo cienfuegos che guevara raul castro and his brother fidel castro after the supreme court decided that the revolution was the source of law and its representatives should assume command
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: fidel castro's forces entered the capital on 1959
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: shortly afterward a liberal lawyer dr manuel urrutia lleo became president
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: he was backed by castro's 26th of july movement because they believed his appointment would be welcomed by the united states
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: disagreements within the government culminated in urrutia's resignation in
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: he was replaced by osvaldo dorticos torrado who served as president until 1976
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: castro became prime minister in succeeding jose miro in head of the state
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: in its first year the new revolutionary government expropriated private property with little or no compensation nationalized public utilities tightened controls on the private sector and closed down the mafia controlled gambling industry
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: the cia conspired with the chicago mafia in 1960 and 1961 to assassinate fidel castro according to documents declassified in 2007
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: some of these measures were undertaken by fidel castro's government in the name of the program outlined in the manifesto of the sierra maestra
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: the government nationalized private property totaling about usd of which american property made up around usd
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: by the end of 1960 the coletilla made its appearance and most newspapers in cuba had been expropriated taken over by the unions or had been abandoned
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: all radio and television stations were in state control
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: moderate teachers and professors were purged
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: in any year about 20000 dissenters were imprisoned
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: some homosexuals religious practitioners and others were sent to labor camps where they were subject to political re education
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: one estimate is that 15000 to 17000 people were executed although the us state department estimates that 3200 people were executed from 1959 to 1962
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: the communist party strengthened its one party rule with castro as ultimate leader
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: fidel's brother raul castro became the army chief
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: loyalty to castro became the primary criterion for all appointments
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: in the revolutionary government created a system known as committees for the defense of the revolution cdr which provided neighborhood spying
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: in the 1961 new year's day parade the administration exhibited soviet tanks and other weapons
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: eventually cuba built up the second largest armed forces in latin america second only to brazil
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: cuba became a privileged client state of the soviet union
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: by 1961 hundreds of thousands of cubans had left for the united states
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: the 1961 bay of pigs invasion la batalla de giron was an unsuccessful attempt to overthrow the cuban government by a u.s.-trained force of cuban exiles with us military support
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: the plan was launched in less than three months after john f kennedy became the us president
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: the cuban armed forces trained and equipped by eastern bloc nations defeated the exiles in three days
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: cuban american relations were exacerbated the following year by the cuban missile crisis when the kennedy administration demanded the immediate withdrawal of soviet nuclear missiles placed in cuba placed in response to us nuclear missiles in turkey and the middle east
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: the soviets and americans soon came to an agreement
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: the soviets would remove soviet missiles from cuba and the americans would remove missiles from turkey and the middle east
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: kennedy also agreed not to invade cuba in the future
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: cuban exiles captured during the bay of pigs invasion were exchanged for a shipment of supplies from america
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: in january 1962 cuba was suspended from the organization of american states oas and later the same year the oas started to impose sanctions against cuba of similar nature to the us sanctions
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: by 1963 cuba was moving towards a full fledged communist system modeled on the ussr
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: the us imposed a complete diplomatic and commercial embargo on cuba and began operation mongoose a program of covert cia operations
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: in 1965 castro merged his revolutionary organizations with the communist party of which he became first secretary blas roca was named second secretary
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: roca was succeeded by raul castro who as defense minister and fidel's closest confidant became and remained the second most powerful figure in cuba until his brother's retirement
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: raul's position was strengthened by the departure of che guevara to launch unsuccessful insurrections in the democratic republic of congo and then bolivia where he was killed in 1967
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: during the 1970s fidel castro dispatched tens of thousands of troops in support of soviet supported wars in africa particularly the mpla in angola and mengistu haile mariam in ethiopia
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: the standard of living in 1970s was extremely spartan and discontent was rife
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: fidel castro admitted the failures of economic policies in a 1970 speech
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: by the mid 1970s castro started economic reforms
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: in 1975 the oas lifted its sanctions against cuba with the approval of 16 member states including the us the us however maintained its own sanctions
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: more than one million cubans of all social classes have left the island to the united states and to spain italy mexico canada sweden and other countries
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: as of 2002 some 1.2 million persons of cuban background about 10% of the current population of cuba reside in the us many of them left the island for the united states often by sea in small boats and fragile rafts
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: on 1980 10000 cubans stormed the peruvian embassy in havana seeking political asylum
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: the following day the cuban government granted permission for the emigration of cubans seeking refuge in the peruvian embassy
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: on 500 cubans left the peruvian embassy for costa rica
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: on many of those cubans started arriving in miami via private boats and were halted by the us state department but the emigration continued because castro allowed anyone who desired to leave the country to do so through the port of mariel
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: over 125000 cubans emigrated to the us before the flow of vessels ended on
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: castro's rule was severely tested in the aftermath of the soviet collapse known in cuba as the special period with effects such as food shortages
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: the government did not accept american donations of food medicines and cash until 1993
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: on 1994 state security dispersed protesters in a spontaneous protest in havana
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: cuba has found a new source of aid and support in the people's republic of china and new allies in hugo chavez president of venezuela and evo morales president of bolivia both major oil and gas exporters
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: in 2003 the government arrested and imprisoned a large number of civil activists a period known as the black spring
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: on july 31 2006 fidel castro temporarily delegated his major duties to his brother first vice president raul castro while fidel recovered from surgery for an acute intestinal crisis with sustained bleeding
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: on 2006 fidel was too ill to attend the 50th anniversary commemoration of the granma boat landing fuelling speculation that he had stomach cancer although there was evidence his illness was a digestive problem and not terminal
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: in january 2007 footage was released of fidel castro meeting venezuelan president hugo chavez in which castro appeared frail but stronger than three months ago
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: in fidel castro announced his resignation as president of cuba and on raul was elected as the new president
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: in his acceptance speech raul promised that some of the restrictions that limit cubans daily lives would be removed
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: in raul castro removed some of fidel castro's officials
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: on 3 june 2009 the oas adopted a resolution to end the 47-year ban on cuban membership of the group
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: the meetings were contentious with the us secretary of state hillary rodham clinton walking out at one point
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: however in the end the us delegation agreed with the other members and approved the resolution
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: the resolution stated however that full membership would be delayed until cuba was in conformity with the practices purposes and principles of the oas cuban leaders have repeatedly announced they are not interested in rejoining the oas and fidel castro restated this after the oas resolution had been announced
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: the cuban government has been accused of numerous human rights abuses including torture arbitrary imprisonment unfair trials and extrajudicial executions also known as el paredon
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: the human rights watch alleges the government represses nearly all forms of political dissent and that cubans are systematically denied basic rights to free expression association assembly privacy movement and due process of law
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: cuba had the second highest number of imprisoned journalists of any nation in 2008 the people's republic of china had the highest according to various sources including the committee to protect journalists cpj an international ngo and human rights watch
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: as a result of ownership restrictions computer ownership rates are among the world's lowest
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: the right to use the internet is granted only to selected locations and they may be monitored
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: connecting to the internet illegally can lead to a five year prison sentence
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: cuban dissidents who commit crimes face arrest and imprisonment
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: in the 1990s human rights watch reported that cuba's extensive prison system one of the largest in latin america consists of some 40 maximum security prisons 30 minimum security prisons and over 200 work camps
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: according to human rights watch political prisoners along with the rest of cuba's prison population are confined to jails with substandard and unhealthy conditions
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: citizens cannot leave or return to cuba without first obtaining official permission in addition to their passport and the visa requirements of their destination
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: the cuban state adheres to socialist principles in organizing its largely state controlled planned economy
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: most of the means of production are owned and run by the government and most of the labor force is employed by the state
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: recent years have seen a trend toward more private sector employment
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: by 2006 public sector employment was 78% and private sector 22% compared to 91.8% to 8.2% in 1981
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: capital investment is restricted and requires approval by the government
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: the cuban government sets most prices and rations goods

lines.value: the constitution of 1976 which defined cuba as a socialist republic was replaced by the constitution of 1992 which is guided by the ideas of jose marti marx engels and lenin

lines.value: the constitution describes the communist party of cuba as the leading force of society and of the state

lines.value: the first secretary of the communist party of cuba is concurrently president of the council of state president of cuba and president of the council of ministers sometimes referred to as premier of cuba

lines.value: members of both councils are elected by the national assembly of people's power
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: the president of cuba who is also elected by the assembly serves for five years and there is no limit to the number of terms of office

lines.value: the supreme court of cuba serves as the nation's highest judicial branch of government

lines.value: it is also the court of last resort for all appeals against the decisions of provincial courts
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: cuba's national legislature the national assembly of people's power asamblea nacional de poder popular is the supreme organ of power 609 members serve five year terms

lines.value: the assembly meets twice a year between sessions legislative power is held by the 31 member council of ministers

lines.value: candidates for the assembly are approved by public referendum

lines.value: all cuban citizens over 16 who have not been convicted of a criminal offense can vote

lines.value: article 131 of the constitution states that voting shall be through free equal and secret vote

lines.value: article 136 states in order for deputies or delegates to be considered elected they must get more than half the number of valid votes cast in the electoral districts

lines.value: votes are cast by secret ballot and counted in public view

lines.value: nominees are chosen at local gatherings from multiple candidates before gaining approval from election committees

lines.value: cuba is an archipelago of islands located in the northern caribbean sea at the confluence with the gulf of mexico and the atlantic ocean
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: it lies between latitudes 19° and 24°n and longitudes 74° and 85°w
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: the united states lies 90 miles across the straits of florida to the north and northwest to the closest tip of key west florida the bahamas to the north haiti to the east jamaica and the cayman islands to the south and mexico to the west
lines.name: Khmer

lines.value: cuba is the principal island surrounded by four smaller groups of islands the colorados archipelago on the northwestern coast the sabana camaguey archipelago on the north central atlantic coast the jardines de la reina on the south central coast and the canarreos archipelago on the southwestern coast

lines.value: cuba is officially a secular state

lines.value: historically cuba has ranked high in numbers of medical personnel and has made significant contributions to world health since the 19th century

lines.value: today cuba has universal health care and although shortages of medical supplies persist there is no shortage of medical personnel

lines.value: primary care is available throughout the island and infant and maternal mortality rates compare favorably with those in developed nations

lines.value: right |thumb|300px|ផែនទីព្រែកជីកប៉ាណាម៉ា ព្រែកជីកប៉ាណាម៉ា the panama canal)​ជាព្រែកជីកសិប្បនិម្មិតនៅទ្វីបអាមេរិកកណ្ដាល​ដែលតភ្ជាប់មហាសមុទ្រប៉ាស៊ីហ្វិកនិងមហាសមុទ្រអាត្លង់ទិក។ វាជាគំរោងវិស្វកម្មដ៏ធំនិងដ៏លំបាកក្នុងប្រវត្តិសាស្ត្រ។ ព្រែកនេះអនុគ្រោះដល់ការដឹកជញ្ជូនទំនិញរវាងមហាសមុទ្រទាំង២ ដោយជំនួសផ្លូវចាស់ដែលវាងតាមជ្រោយហន ចុងខាងត្បូងបំផុតនៃទ្វីបអាមេរិកខាងត្បូង)និងមានចំងាយវែង។ នាវាដែលដឹកទំនិញពីក្រុងញូយ៉កទៅក្រុងសាន់ហ្វ្រាន់ស៊ីស្កូ​ដោយកាត់តាមព្រែកនេះ ធ្វើដំនើរក្នុងចំងាយតែ ៩ ៥០០គ.ម ខណៈការធ្វើដំនើរវាងតាមជ្រោយហនមានចំងាយ ២២ ៥០០គ.ម។ កិច្ចប្រឹងប្រែងស្ថាបនាព្រែកជីកនេះចាប់ផ្ដើមនៅឆ្នាំ ១៨៨០ ពេលដែលបារាំងបានមកគ្រប់គ្រងតំបន់នេះ។ កិច្ចប្រឹងប្រែងនេះបានបរាជ័យដោយមានកម្មករប្រមាណ ២១ ៩០០នាក់បានបាត់បង់ជីវិត។ កិច្ចប្រឹងប្រែងរបស់អាមេរិកនៅដើមសតវត្សរ៍ទី២០ បានបញ្ចប់គំរោងនេះជាស្ថាពរនៅឆ្នាំ ១៩១៤។ ព្រែកនេះមានប្រវែងតែ ៧៧គ.ម ទេ តែការសាងសង់វាប្រឈមមុខនឹងបញ្ហាជាច្រើនមានជំងឺដង្កាត់ ជាពិសេសជំងឺគ្រុនចាញ់និងជំងឺគ្រុនលឿង និងការបាក់ដី។ នៅពេលដែលគំរោងបានបញ្ចប់ គេប៉ាន់ប្រមាណថាមានកម្មករប្រមាណ ២៧ ៥០០នាក់បានបាត់បង់ជីវិត ក្នុងកិច្ចប្រឹងប្រែងទាំង២របស់បារាំងនិងអាមេរិក។

lines.value: ពន្ធ​លើ​តំលៃ​ប​ន្ថៃ​ម​ ​vat ​ត្រូវ​បាន​អនុវត្ត​សម្រាប់​ ​របប​ពិត​នៃ​អ្នក​បង់ពន្ធ​ចាប់ពី​ថ្ងៃ​ទី​ ​១ មក​រា​ ​១៩៩៩ មក​។​ ​ក្រោម​ប្រព័ន្ធ​ ​vat ​ពន្ធ​លើ​ទិន្នផល​ ​"output tax​ ត្រូវ​ប្រមូល​ពី​អតិថិជន​ដោយ​បន្ថែម​ ​vat ​ទៅ​លើ​ចំនួន​ដែល​គេ​បាន​ចំណាយ​។​ ​ទោះបីជា​យ៉ាងណា​ក៏​ដោយ​ក៏​អាជីវករ​ត្រូវ​បង់​ផង​ដែរ​នូវ​ពន្ធ​លើ​ធនធាន​ដើម​ ​"input​ ​tax​ ទៅ​អ្នក​ផ្គត់ផ្គង់​លើ​តម្លៃដែល​ ​ខ្លួន​បាន​ជាវ​។​ ​អាជីវករ​ត្រូវ​បង់​ output tax​បន្ទាប់​ពី​ដក​រំ​លួស​ ​input​ ​tax​ ​ដែល​បង់​អោយ​អ្នក​ផ្គត់ផ្គង់​រួច​។​ ​តាម​ទ្រឹស្តី​ ​អាជីវករ​បង់ពន្ធ​លើតម្លៃ​ដែល​បន្ថែម​ទៅ​ក្នុង​ចង្វាក់​ផ្គត់ផ្គង់​។​ ​ពន្ធ​នេះ​កើតឡើង​ដោយ​អ្នកទិញ​ ​រឺ​អាជីវករ​ដែល​ត្រូវ​ ​លើកលែង​ពី​ពន្ធ​ពេល​ដែល​អ្នកទិញ​ ​រឺ​អាជីវករ​មិន​អាច​ទារ​ input tax​ ​ដែល​បង់​បាន​។​

lines.value: ប្រព័ន្ធ​ ​vat ​របស់​កម្ពុជា​បច្ចុប្បន្ន​កំណត់​ត្រឹម​សកម្មភាព​អាជីវកម្ម​នៃ​អ្នក​បង់ពន្ធ​របប​ពិត​ ​ដែល​ផលិត​នូវ​របស់​ផ្គត់ផ្គង់​ ​ដែល​ត្រូវ​បង់ពន្ធ​ហើយ​រួម​ទាំង​អ្នក​នាំ​ចូល​ខ្លះ​។​ ​សូម​មើល​ខាងក្រោមៈ​ អ្នក​បង់ពន្ធ​របប​ពិត​រួម​មាន​អ្នក​បង់ពន្ធ​ ​incorperated​ ​និង​ large​ ​ដែល​ទាក់ទង​ដល់​ផលិតកម្ម​ពាណិជ្ជកម្ម​ ​និង​ ​សេវាកម្ម​។​ ​ក្នុង​ករណី​នីមួយៗ​អាជីវករ​ត្រូវ​បង់​ ​vat ​លើ​តម្លៃ​នៃ​ទំនិញ​ ​រឺ​សេវា​ដែល​ត្រូវ​ផ្គត់ផ្គង់​។​ ​ការ​បង់ពន្ធ​លើ​ ​របប​មិន​ពិត​អាច​នឹង​ត្រូវ​បញ្ចូល​ទៅ​ក្នុង​ប្រព័ន្ធ​ ​vat ​នា​​ពេល​ក្រោយ​។​ vat ​ក៏​អនុវត្ត​ផង​ដែរ​លើ​តម្លៃ​នៃ​អាករ​លើ​ទំនិញ​ដែល​នាំ​ចូល​ដោយ​រួម​មាន​សម្បទាន​ ​ទោះបី​សម្រាប់​អ្នក​នាំ​ចេញ​ក៏​ដោយ​ ​ទំនិញ​ដែល​លើកលែង​ពន្ធ​ខ្លះ​មាន​បារី​ ​គ្រឿង​ស្រវឹង​ ​ផលិតផល​គ្រឿងយន្ត​ដែល​នាំ​ចូល​សម្រាប់​គាំទ្រ​ដល់​ការ​កែ​ច្នៃ​នាំ​ចេញ​។​ ​ទំនិញ​ដែល​នាំ​ចូល​អាច​ចាត់ទុកជា​សេវា​ភ្ជាប់​រួម​។​ ​អ្នក​នាំ​ចូល​ត្រូវ​បង់​ ​vat ​ដល់​គយ​នៅ​ក្នុង​ពេល​ដែល​អ្នក​នាំ​ចូល​នោះ​ ​បង់ពន្ធ​នាំ​ចូល​។​ ​vat ​អាច​ត្រូវ​បង់​នៅ​ពេល​ទំនិញ​ណាមួយ​ត្រូវ​គេ​ចាត់​ទុក​ថា​សម្រាប់​ប្រើប្រាស់​ជា​បុគ្គល ​រឺ​ក៏ ​ជា​អំណោយ​។​

lines.value: ពាក្យ​ថា​បាយ័ន អ្នក​គ្រូ ពៅ សាវរស បាន​លើក​យក​គំនិត​របស់​លោក ប្វាស្សឺលីយ៉េរ៍ boisselier ដែល​បាន​កំណត់​លើ​ឫស​នៃ​ពាក្យ​នេះ ដោយ​បាន​លើក​ឡើង​ថា បាយ័ន​ជា​ស្នា​ដៃ​របស់ ព្រះ​បាទ​ជយវរ្ម័ន ទី ៧ ដែល​បាន​កសាង​នៅ​ក្នុង​ប្លង់​ខុស​គេ មាន​រាង​មូល ដែល​រំលឹក​ដល់​យន្ត្រ។ គំនិត​ខាង​លើ​នេះ​មិន​អាច​យក​ជា​ការ​បាន​ទេ ហើយ​អ្នក​គ្រូ ពៅ សាវរស បាន​បន្ថែម​ទៅ​គំនិត​របស់​លោក សេដែស cœdes ដែល​បាន​ឲ្យ​យោបល់​ប្រៀប​ធៀប​នៃ​ពាក្យ​បាយ័ន ជា​មួយ វជយន្ត ដែល​និយាយ​នៅ​ក្នុង​សិលាចារឹក។ វជយន្ត គឺ​ជា​វាំង​របស់​ព្រះ​ឥន្ទ បើ​តាម​អត្ថបទ ល្បើក​អង្គរវត្ត ដែល​បាន​សរសេរ​ឡើង​នៅ​ក្នុង​សម័យ​កណ្តាល គឺ​ព្រះ​ឥន្ទ​បាន​ឲ្យ​ព្រះ​ពិស្ណុការ វិឝ្វកម៌ន៑ ចុះ​មក​ឋាន​កណ្តាល​ ដើម្បី​ក​សាង​ប្រាសាទ​ឲ្យ​ព្រះ​កេតុ​មាលា ដែល​រំលឹក​ដល់​វាំង​របស់​ព្រះ​អង្គ​ក្នុង​គំនិត​ខ្មែរ គឺ​ពេជយន្តរត្ន ឬ ទេវ​ជយន្ត។ ឈ្មោះ​មក​ពី​ការ​ធ្វើ​ឡើង​វិញ​ជា​ច្រើន និង​ការ​បង្ហាញ​ពី​ការ​ធ្វើ​ឲ្យ​ដូច​ទៅ​នឹង​ស្នា​ដៃ​ នៅ​លើ​ផែន​ដី​របស់​វិឝ្វកម៌ន៑។

lines.value: | align=center colspan=2 style="background ffffff | ស្ដាំ|350px| បាយ,​ពាណិជ្ជកម្ម វិស័យអប់រំ ,ការកំសាន្ដ ,ប្រព័ន្ធផ្សព្វផ្សាយ ,កន្លែងដែលពេញនិយម ,វិទ្យាសាស្រ្ដ និង សិល្បះ ដែលជាកន្លែងចេញវិភាគទាន ដូចទីក្រុងប្រជុំអ្នកដឹកនាំរបស់ពិភពលោក។​ ប៉ារីស និង ភូមិភាគប៉ារីស មាន ការកើន ឡើងយ៉ាងឆាប់ រហ័សនូវ gdp(ផលិតផលជាតិសរុប របស់ប្រទេសបារាំង ជាមួយនិងទឹក ប្រាក់ប្រមាណជា ៨១៣.៤ កោដិដុល្លា។ បើយោងតាមការសន្និដ្ឋាន កាលពីរឆ្នាំ ២០០៧ បានអោយដឹងថា ភាពផ្ដុំ នៃ ទីក្រុងប៉ារីស គឺជាទីក្រុង សេដ្ឋកិច្ចធំជាងគេបង្អស់របស់ទ្វីបអ៊ឺរ៉ុប ហើយ ធំជាងគេទី៦ នៃពិភពលោក។ ទីក្រុងប៉ារីស គឺជាកន្លែងទទួលភ្ញៀង៣៨ នៃ ក្រុមហ៊ុន ហ្វតធូន ក្លូបល ៥០០ នៅក្នុងតំបន់សេដ្ឋកិច្ច មួយចំនួន ។ គួរកត់សំគាល់ថា ឡាឌ័រហ្វែន គឺជាកន្លែងធំបំផុតនៃការរីកចំរើននៃពាណិជ្ជកម្ម នៅក្នុងទ្វីបអ៊ឺរ៉ុប ។ ប៉ារីស ជាកន្លែងដែលមានអង្គការអន្ដរជាតិជា ច្រើនផងដែរដូចជា unesco អង្គការសហប្រតិបត្ដិការ ដើម្បីអភិវឌ្ឈន៏ សេដ្ឋកិច្ច(oecd ,សភាពាណិជ្ជកម្មអន្ដរជាតិ(icc និង សមាគមទីក្រុងប៉ារីស។ បើយោងតាម សេចក្ដីរាយការណ៏ នៃការស្ទាប់ស្ទង់ កាលពីរឆ្នាំ ២០១០របស់ក្រុម សេដ្ឋកិច្ចវិទូ មួយបានអោយដឹងថា ប៉ារីស គឺជា

lines.value: ឈ្មោះផ្លូវការនៃប្រទេសនេះជាភាសាខ្មែរគឺ ព្រះរាជាណាចក្រកម្ពុជា ជារឿយៗត្រូវបានគេកាត់ខ្លីថាកម្ពុជា។ តាមគ្រាមភាសា ខ្មែរភាគច្រើនតែងហៅប្រទេសរបស់ខ្លួនថា ស្រុកខ្មែរ ដែលមានន័យថា ដែនដីនៃពួកខ្មែរ រឺ តាមការប្រើប្រាស់ទម្រង់មិនសូវផ្លូវការមួយទៀត ប្រទេសកម្ពុជា ។ បើតាមវចនានុក្រមសម្ដេចសង្ឃរាជជួន-ណាតបានពិពណ៌នាថា ពាក្យ​នេះ​ជា​ឈ្មោះ​នៃ ប្រទេស​ខ្មែរ​យើង យើង​ហៅ​ប្រទេស​របស់​យើង​ថា កម្ពុជ​រដ្ឋ ក៏​បាន ថា កម្ពុជ​ប្រទេស ក៏​បាន ថា ប្រទេស​កម្ពុជា ក៏​បាន ថា ប្រទេស​ខ្មែរ ក៏​បាន ថា ខេមរ​ប្រទេស ក៏​បាន ថា ខេមរ​រដ្ឋ ក៏​បាន កាល​ណា​បើ​កវី​ជាតិ​យើង​ត្រូវ​ការ​ប្រើ​ក្នុង​កាព្យ ឬ​ក្នុង​ការ​តែង​សេចក្ដី​ជា​ពាក្យ​រាយ​ខ្លះ យើង​អាច​ហៅ​ប្រទេស​យើង​បាន​តាម​ត្រូវ​ការ ប៉ុន្តែ​ពាក្យ​ប្រើ​ក្នុង​ផ្លូវ​ការ យើង​សរសេរ យើង​ហៅ កម្ពុជ​រដ្ឋ ឬ ប្រទេស​កម្ពុជា ឯ​ជន​បរទេស គេ​ហៅ​តាម​យើង​ដែរ​ក៏​មាន គេ​ហៅ​តាម​ការ​សន្មតិ​របស់​គេ​ក៏​មាន ដូច​ជា​បារាំងសែស គេ​ហៅ​ប្រទេស​យើង​ថា​ cambodge អង្គ្លេស ហៅ​ថា cambodia អ្នក​បរទេស​ខ្លះ​ទៀត​ហៅ​ថា cambodja ខ្លះ​ហៅ kambuja ។ល។ កម្ពុជាត្រូវបានគេស្គាល់ជាទូទៅថា cambodia ជាភាសាអង់គ្លេស និង cambodge"/"kamboj ជាភាសាបារាំង។ កម្ពុជា កាន់តែត្រូវបានគេស្គាល់យ៉ាងទូលំទូលាយដោយពួកលោកខាងកើត និង cambodia ត្រូវបានគេស្គាល់យ៉ាងទូលំទូលាយដោយពួកលោកខាងលិច។

lines.value: មានភស្តុតាងស្ដួចស្ដើងចំពោះការកាន់កាប់របស់មនុស្សជំនាន់អតិកញ្ញៈ pleistocene នៃកម្ពុជាសម័យបច្ចុប្បន្ន ដែលរួមមានឧបករណ៍ក្រួសហនុមានខៀវ quartz)និងក្វាតហ៊្សីត ដែលបានរកឃើញក្នុងស្រែថ្នាក់ៗជាច្រើនតាមបណ្ដោយទន្លេមេគង្គ ក្នុងខេត្តស្ទឹងត្រែង និងក្រចេះ និងក្នុងខេត្តកំពត ទោះបីជាយ៉ាងណាការចុះកាលបរិច្ឆេទរបស់ទាំងនោះមិនអាចយកជាការបានទេ។ ភស្តុតាងបុរាណវិទ្យាតិចតួចខ្លះបង្ហាញឱ្យឃើញសហគមន៍នៃពួកអ្នកប្រមាញ់-អ្នកបេះផ្លែឈើ​បានតាំងលំនៅនៅកម្ពុជាកំឡុងជំនាន់​សវ៌កញ្ញៈ holocene ស្ថានីយបុរាណវត្ថុវិទ្យាកម្ពុជាដ៏ចំណាស់បំផុតត្រូវគេគិតទុកថាជារូងភ្នំល្អាងស្ពាន នៅខេត្តបាត់ដំបង ដែលត្រូវនឹងសម័យហ្វាប៊ីញ។ កំណាយក្នុងស្រទាប់ក្រោមដីបានផលិតនូវតំណបន្តនៃវិទ្យុកាបូនមួយដែលចុះកាលបរិច្ឆេទថានៅឆ្នាំ ៦០០០ ម.គ.។ ដែកត្រូវបានគេយកមកប្រើការនៅប្រហែលឆ្នាំ ៥០០ ម.គ

lines.value: អង្គការសហប្រជាជាតិ​(អ.ស.ប)(the united nations un)គឺជាអង្គការអន្តរជាតិសំរាប់និតិអន្តរជាតិ​ សន្តិសុខអន្តរជាតិ​ ការអភិវឌ្ឍន៍សេដ្ឋកិច្ច​ ការរីកចំរើននៃសង្គម​និង​បញ្ហាសិទ្ធិមនុស្ស។​អ.ស.ប​ត្រូវបានបង្កើតឡើងនៅឆ្នាំ​១៩៤៥​ដើម្បីជំនួស​អង្គការសង្គមប្រជាជាតិ(the league of nations)​ក្នុងគោលដៅចូលអន្តរាគមន៍​ដោះស្រាយជម្លោះរវាងរដ្ឋជាសមាជិក​និង​បញ្ចៀសមិនអោយ​មាន​សង្គ្រាមលោកសារជាថ្មីម្ដងទៀត។

lines.value: ការបកប្រែស្នាដៃរបស់ប៉ារ្មេននីឌីសបុរាណគឺថាលោកបានលើកឡើងថាការយល់ដឹងនៃតថភាពពិភពលោកតាមបែបរូបិយ តាមដែលបានពិពណ៌នាក្នុង ប៉ារ្មេននីឌីស#វិថីនៃមតិយោបល់ គឺខុស និងយល់ថាតថភាពនៃពិភពលោកគឺ ការមានតែមួយ ដែលបានរៀបរាប់ក្នុង aletheia ទាំងមូលមិនប្រែប្រួល មិនបានកើត មិនបាត់បង់។ នៅក្នុងទស្សនវិជ្ជាប្រវត្តិសាស្ត្ររបស់លោកហ៊ីហ៊្គើល ឃ្លា weltgeschichte ist weltgericht ប្រវត្តិសាស្ត្រពិភពលោកគឺជាចៅក្រមដែលកាត់ក្ដីឱ្យលោកនេះ ត្រូវបានប្រើដើម្បីសំអាងទិដ្ឋភាព ប្រវត្តិសាស្ត្រនោះគឺជាអ្វីដែលកាត់ក្ដីមនុស្ស នូវទង្វើ និង គំនិតរបស់ខ្លួន។ វិទ្យាសាស្ត្រកើតមកដោយសារចេតនាដើម្បីកែប្រែពិភពលោកឱ្យមានទំនាក់ទំនងនឹងមនុស្ស ទីបញ្ចប់ចុងក្រោយរបស់វិទ្យាសាស្ត្រគឺជាកិច្ចអនុវត្តខាងបច្ចេកទេស។ the world as will and representation is the central work of arthur schopenhauer
